page.title: 12A Child's View of Warton
page.content: My family have lived in Warton for about 70 years. First was my great, great Grandad Tom. My great Uncle was the manager of the Co-op. Grandad told me about the changes in the village before and after the war. Croftlands estate is where the cricket and foot- ball were. The cricket moved away near the A6 to Earl Peel's land for a pound a year rent to make room for Council houses. The Post Office used to be near the church gates and the next door cottage was a general store. I go to Brownies and Dancing, and have just joined the Church Choir. My Grandad was in the Church Choir. I go to the same school as Mummy and Daddy went to. Daddy plays cricket for the first team and is very good. My Uncle David and Uncle Tony play for the same team. E.R. aged 9
